sub_title: Reception Supervisor | Hotel Front Desk Receptionist & Tourism Executive
summary:
Hello, Hallo, Bonjour, Hola ! 
Welcome and pleased to meet you. I am Fernando, a passionate and experienced professional in the hotel and tourism industry. 

I am currently working as a Reception Supervisor at the Meininger Amstel Hotel in Amsterdam, which is part of the Meininger Hotel Group, and has 186 rooms for 806 Beds. I am responsible for supervising front desk team members and ensuring standard operating procedures, as well as all front-desk duties such as check-in and out guests, managing reservation via SIHOT software system, computing billing, taking payments and dealing with all related queries from guests. 

I have over 10 years of experience in the hotel  and tourism industry  and a degree in Tourism Management. I have previously worked in hotels in Chile (Santiago de Chile) and in France (Paris). I also have considerable experience as a Travel Agent and Sales Representative, having worked for two years in national and international travel & tours agencies. Through these experiences I developed strong communication skills, leadership, the ability to think on my feet and first and foremost: a great passion for the tourism and hospitality industry. 

I hold an Advanced Bachelor (5 years degree) in Tourism Management from the Metropolitan University of Technology in Santiago de Chile, which gave me solid and practical skills in administration, strategy in hospitality markets, accounting, strategic management and budgeting. 

Being originally from Chile in South America I am a native speaker of Spanish, and having also lived 3 years in Paris I am proficient in French. I also speak English and I have lived for a few months at a time in Vermont,  USA and Sheffield, England where I worked and volunteered. I enjoy speaking foreign languages: I am also teaching myself Portuguese and I would love to learn Dutch now that I live here in The Netherlands!

I am a dedicated, hard-working person with an attention for details and solid customer-focused interpersonal skills. I enjoy providing excellent service, solve problems and work effectively with my team. Want to know more about me ? Let’s connect and chat!

education.degree_name: Bachelor degree in Tourism Management (5 years)

profile_positions.description:
Working at location : Meininger Amstel Amsterdam (186 rooms, 806 Beds)
 •  Supervise front desk team members, oversee all front desk processes. and be in charge of daily shift.
 •  Direct the workflow and coordinate with other departments (housekeeping, Food and Beverage, etc)
 •  Train new receptionists, coach junior members.
 •  Administrative support (invoices, expenses, POS terminal balance check)
 •  Resolve guest issues and complaints in an efficient manner, and ensure outstanding customer service.
profile_positions.title: Reception Supervisor

profile_positions.description:
Working at location : Meininger Amstel Amsterdam (186 rooms, 806 Beds)
 •  Around-the-clock reception schedule, requiring great flexibility with day/night shifts.
 •  Manage reservations via SIHOT hotel management software.
 •  Complete check-in and check-out procedures upon arrivals/departures in a fast-paced environment, often with large groups of guests.
 •  Ensure proper room allocation and liaise with housekeeping and maintenance teams for best efficiency.
 •  Deal with questions and requests by phone, email, face-to-face and explain services and facilities.
•  Effectively exchange and communicate information with other front desk colleagues and other teams (Food&Beverage, Bar, Cleaning…).
•  Complete activity and incident reports for management.
 •  Monitor visitors and apply hotel rules and policies, while always providing an outstanding guest experience.
•  Compute billing, take payments and maintain updated internal records with great attention to detail and accuracy.
profile_positions.title: Front Desk Receptionist

profile_positions.description:
Working at location : Le Regent Montmartre, Boutique Hotel, Paris
 •  Register, check-in and check-out guests
 •  Verify method of payment, handle cash payments and basic accounting
 •  Accommodate special requests
 •  Solve all hotel-related problems under pressure and at high pace
 •  Answer calls, screen and redirect
 •  Provide accurate information in person, by phone and email in several languages
 •  Maintain hotel security by following safety procedures
 •  Arrange taxis and car transfers per request
 •  Up-sell guest rooms and promote hotel services
profile_positions.title: Front Desk Receptionist

profile_positions.description:
•  Sell travel packages, transportation, accommodations, insurance and other travel services
 •  Issue electronic ticketing on AMADEUS system
 •  Determine client needs and recommend them appropriate destination, costs and dates.
 •  Provide relevant information such as guides, maps, regulations and more
 •  Use promotional techniques and materials to sell travel packages
 •  Deal with potential travel issues, complaints or refunds
 •  Update data into software to maintain client files and information
 •  Meet demanding weekly sales targets
profile_positions.title: Travel Agent

profile_positions.description:
•  Welcome, greet and advise clients with sightseeing advice
 •  Assess customers needs and maximise sales by suggesting upgrades.
 •  Offer excellent customer service, deal with complaints and resolve conflict with clients
 •  Sell additional services, quote tours and convert to bookings
 •  Meet high weekly and monthly sales targets
profile_positions.title: Tours & Trip Sales Representative

profile_positions.description:
•  Day and night shifts: welcome guests and register them as they arrive.
 •  Check-in and check-out guests, room allocation and hotel space optimisation
 •  Put together the guest's bill, take payments in cash, credit or debit card.
 •  Help guests with any special requests : manage luggage area, order taxis or book tickets, etc.
 •  Report issues of maintenance to the manager to ensure guests satisfaction.
profile_positions.title: Front Desk Receptionist

volunteer_experiences.description:
Volunteer position in a kitchen, to meet the needs of homeless and vulnerable people in Sheffield, UK.

 •  Support cook in preparation of meals 
 •  Ensure high standards are maintained
 •  Follow food regulation requirements
 •  Wash up and general kitchen cleanliness

volunteer_experiences.role: Waffle Maker and Shop Assistant - Vermont,  USA
volunteer_experiences.description:
Spent five month in Vermont,  USA in order to improve my English and get to know the US culture and hospitality industry. I worked at the following Ski centres: Killington, Stowe and Bolton Valley.

 •  Greet customers, make waffles, clean kitchen and serving areas
 •  Maintain high hygiene standards at all times
 •  Demonstrate a friendly, positive and can-do attitude, especially under pressure at peak times
 •  Process payments, follow cash handling policies and procedures
 •  Anticipate customer’s needs and expectations, and provide an outstanding customer experience
